greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n is the a(n)-th positive integer having its binary weight.
comment: Binary weight is given by A000120.
Ordinal transform of A000120. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 23 2018
link: Paul Tek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Paul Tek, PERL program for this sequence
example: The numbers with binary weight 3 are: 7, 11, 13, 14, 19, ...
And more generally: a(A014311(k))=k for any k>0.
maple: a:= proc() option remember; local a, b, t; b, a:=
proc() 0 end, proc(n) option remember; a(n-1);
t:= add(i, i=convert(n, base, 2)); b(t):= b(t)+1
program: f x m = y : f (x + 1) (insert h (y + 1) m) where
return sum([1 for i in range(n) if bin(i)[2:].count("1")==x]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 24 2017
results.author: _Paul Tek_, Oct 07 2015
